result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alfredo O Santos

records.addlTxt: Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Shelton, Br. 40.

Defendant Alfredo O Santos in court.  Attorney Christian Thomas in court for Alfredo O Santos.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Kelley Salas.
Court took judicial notice of the defendants 5 prior OWI convictions. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer N. Cramer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
Received and Filed.
Notice of Appearance.  Received and Filed.  nk
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense.  Signed and Filed.  nk

Defendant Alfredo O Santos in court with attorney Christian Thomas.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

SPANISH INTERPRETER SWORN: Enrique Barbosas

Case in court for state v. lee hearing.  Defendant is eligible for counsel to be appointed at county expense.  Defendant is not ordered to re-pay the county.  The court appoint Attorney Christian Thomas to represent the defendant.  Counsel accepts the appointment and waives time limit for preliminary hearing.   Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Alfredo O Santos in court in person.  Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.    Sworn as interpreter: Sarah Chwaszczewski. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-3-2022
Pretrial Services Supervision (VIOLATION) Report; filed.

Defendant Alfredo O Santos in court.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Reme Bashi
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests this matter be set for a State V.  Lee hearing in the trial court; denied.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
SPD Appointment of Counsel Report; filed.

Defendant Alfredo O Santos in court, appear in person.  Edward OBrien appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Hilda Shymanik.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision Level 3.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  Scram bracelet ordered to monitor defendant maintains absolute sobriety.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Alfredo O Santos in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Alfredo O Santos in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alfredo O Santos appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Alfredo O Santos
Current: 6121 W Lapham St, Milwaukee, WI 53214   (Effective: 05-04-2022)
Prior: 2349 South 17th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215
Sworn as interpreter:  Fred Svensson
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
